content: I have my Coronation outfit ready - and there’s not a spot of red, white or blueREAD MORE: FEMAIL picks out a selection of camel classicsPARTY IN PINKTa-da! I have my Coronation outfit ready - and there’s not a spot of red, white or blue.

Nope, I’m in head-to-toe pink.Greta Gerwig’s Barbie movie is coming and that means one thing is for certain: the trend for fuchsia is here and I couldn’t be happier.Even staunch minimalists like me want a little colour in our lives, and this lurid pink is one I’ve got used to. There’s comfort in familiarity.

NOT SO BIMBOYes, yes, pink traditionally has connotations of a certain ‘bimbo’ aesthetic, but get with it, people: Legally Blonde was released in 2001. In 2023, we’re all wearing it. It has become the definitive celebratory hue: a bold, bright, feminist statement. If you think it’s too loud, too look-at-me, then get over it - you’re not going to be the centre of attention this Saturday, with Charles in a robe that’s made of actual gold thread.HAUTE TO HIGH STREETNow if money were no object, I’d treat myself to Valentino’s crepe floral-applique wool-blend dress from their fuchsia-toned runway show, but it’s £8,400. And money is very much an object. Instead, I’ll turn to the High Street. This vivid pink textured silk-linen dress from Jigsaw is a real find. It’s comfortable for relaxed daywear and the bias cut means it doesn’t cling. If you want something more fun, take a look at Kitri’s feathered design below — perfect for your Coronation after-party.MAKE IT HOTWhatever you choose, make sure it’s in a rich, vibrant hue. To nail the trend, you want a properly saturated pink (this is also one of the easiest tricks to making a garment look expensive).
